column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Then the Grand Gorilla got up and said ,
#Text=“ I think we all should go to him and ask him to stay .
#Text=Perhaps if we make him a new house and a bigger bed , and promise him plenty of monkey-servants to work for him and to make life pleasant for him — perhaps then he will not wish to go . ”
#Text=Then Chee-Chee got up ; and all the others whispered , “ Sh ! Look !
#Text=Chee-Chee , the great Traveler , is about to speak ! ”
#Text=And Chee-Chee said to the other monkeys ,
#Text=“ My friends , I am afraid it is useless to ask the Doctor to stay .
#Text=He owes money in Puddleby ; and he says he must go back and pay it . ”
#Text=And the monkeys asked him , “ What is money ? ”
#Text=“ Then the Grand Gorilla got up ”
#Text=Then Chee-Chee told them that in the Land of the White Men you could get nothing without money ; you could do nothing without money — that it was almost impossible to live without money .
#Text=And some of them asked , “ But can you not even eat and drink without paying ? ”
#Text=But Chee-Chee shook his head .
#Text=And then he told them that even he , when he was with the organ-grinder , had been made to ask the children for money .
#Text=And the Chief Chimpanzee turned to the Oldest Orang-outang and said , “ Cousin , surely these Men be strange creatures !
#Text=Who would wish to live in such a land ?
#Text=My gracious , how paltry ! ”
#Text=Then Chee-Chee said ,
#Text=“ When we were coming to you we had no boat to cross the sea in and no money to buy food to eat on our journey .
#Text=So a man lent us some biscuits ; and we said we would pay him when we came back .
#Text=And we borrowed a boat from a sailor ; but it was broken on the rocks when we reached the shores of Africa .
#Text=Now the Doctor says he must go back and get the sailor another boat — because the man was poor and his ship was all he had . ”
#Text=And the monkeys were all silent for a while , sitting quite still upon the ground and thinking hard .
#Text=At last the Biggest Baboon got up and said ,
#Text=“ I do not think we ought to let this good man leave our land till we have given him a fine present to take with him , so that he may know we are grateful for all that he has done for us . ”
#Text=And a little , tiny red monkey who was sitting up in a tree shouted down ,
#Text=“ I think that too ! ”
#Text=And then they all cried out , making a great noise , “ Yes , yes .
#Text=Let us give him the finest present a White Man ever had ! ”
#Text=Now they began to wonder and ask one another what would be the best thing to give him .
#Text=And one said , “ Fifty bags of cocoanuts ! ” And another — “ A hundred bunches of bananas ! —
#Text=At least he shall not have to buy his fruit in the Land Where You Pay to Eat ! ”
#Text=But Chee-Chee told them that all these things would be too heavy to carry so far and would go bad before half was eaten .
#Text=“ If you want to please him , ” he said , “ give him an animal .
#Text=You may be sure he will be kind to it .
#Text=Give him some rare animal they have not got in the menageries . ”
#Text=And the monkeys asked him , “ What are menageries ? ”
#Text=Then Chee-Chee explained to them that menageries were places in the Land of the White Men , where animals were put in cages for people to come and look at .
#Text=And the monkeys were very shocked and said to one another ,
#Text=“ These Men are like thoughtless young ones — stupid and easily amused .
#Text=Sh ! It is a prison he means . ”
#Text=So then they asked Chee-Chee what rare animal it could be that they should give the Doctor — one the White Men had not seen before .
#Text=And the Major of the Marmosettes asked ,
#Text=“ Have they an iguana over there ? ”
#Text=But Chee-Chee said , “ Yes , there is one in the London Zoo . ”
#Text=And another asked , “ Have they an okapi ? ”
#Text=But Chee-Chee said , “ Yes .
#Text=In Belgium , where my organ-grinder took me five years ago , they had an okapi in a big city they call Antwerp . ”
#Text=And another asked , “ Have they a pushmi-pullyu ? ”
#Text=Then Chee-Chee said , “ No.
#Text=No White Man has ever seen a pushmi-pullyu .
#Text=Let us give him that . ”
#Text=THE TENTH CHAPTER
#Text=THE RAREST ANIMAL OF ALL
#Text=PUSHMI-PULLYUS are now extinct .
#Text=That means , there are n’t any more .
#Text=But long ago , when Doctor Dolittle was alive , there were some of them still left in the deepest jungles of Africa ; and even then they were very , very scarce .
#Text=They had no tail , but a head at each end , and sharp horns on each head .
#Text=They were very shy and terribly hard to catch .
#Text=The black men get most of their animals by sneaking up behind them while they are not looking .
#Text=But you could not do this with the pushmi-pullyu — because , no matter which way you came towards him , he was always facing you .
#Text=And besides , only one half of him slept at a time .
#Text=The other head was always awake — and watching .
#Text=This was why they were never caught and never seen in Zoos .

#Text=Though many of the greatest huntsmen and the cleverest menagerie-keepers spent years of their lives searching through the jungles in all weathers for pushmi-pullyus , not a single one had ever been caught .
#Text=Even then , years ago , he was the only animal in the world with two heads .
